climbs.name: Tiger's Eye
climbs.fa: Euan Cameron and Julie Wright, 16th August 2010

content.description:
Start with hands on the ledge at 6 feet.   Get standing on this ledge and clip the first bolt.   Pass the first and second bolts via very thins moves and the use of one or two micro flakes.

After bolts 3 and 4 the climbing gets more sustained and much better.   As the slab steepens continue directly up the wall above with engaging and enjoyable moves to the crux sequence to gain the good sized flake at the top of this steep section.

With the large flake at hand continue more easily up the slab above to the anchors.
content.location: Left side of the main wall

content.description: Face climb up to the 1st bolt and start some interesting moves from the 2nd to the 3rdbolt(crux) moving left and up. After you gain the 1st ledge, the climbing moves over to the arete moving up and left using a horn for protection until your able to pull yourself on top of the arete. From here use the old chain anchors or move up another 15ft to Cleaning Lady anchors(kinda runout but on easy ground).
content.protection: 5 Bolts, and 1 single length sling for a horn at the top. Old Chains for the anchor or go up and left and us Cleaning Lady anchors.
content.location: Next bolted line right of Cleaning Lady. Starts near the arete. Doesn't look like anyone really climbs this and the other two sport routes to the right of it very often.

content.description:
This climb comes at you hard and fast.

Start easily enough until a steep wall is reached.   Climb this wall on good side pulls and flakes until an easy slabby crack is reached.  Follow this to the anchors.
content.location: The leftmost route on the crag.

content.description: Start to the right of Leaner. Climb up the face to the communal anchor shared with Leaner.
content.protection: Three bolts and gear to an anchor.
content.location: Start to the right of Leaner.

content.description: Start to the right of Ringer and climb up and slightly right to reach the communal anchor. Lower off.
content.protection: Two bolts and gear to an anchor.
content.location: Start to the right of Ringer.

content.description: Start to the right of Pitching Box at a slab. Climb the slab to an anchor.
content.protection: Three bolts and gear to an anchor.
content.location: Start to the right of Pitching Box at a slab.

content.description: Climb the obvious broken dihedral.   Tricky moves midway up the first section and another tricky section at the top of the second are easily protected.
content.location: Obvious dihedral on the right side

climbs.name: Full Yellow Jacket
climbs.fa: Euan Cameron and Julie Wright, 29th August 2008

content.description:
Start up thin moves to the first bolt, and continue via thinner technical climbing up to the second bolt.  After the 2nd bolt the climbing eases as it ascends the slab via a thin flake sidepull.

Interesting moves passed the 6th bolt lead on up to the finishing moves and the anchors.

Good rock and solid technical moves make this the best of the climbs up the slab.
content.location:
Middle of the slab, between

Fall Harvest

and

Cleaning Lady

content.description: The start up the vertical wall provides the first crux.   Enjoyable slab climbing brings you up to near the anchors where the second balancy crux is encountered.
content.location:
Located just to the right of the prominent left facing corner,

D.D.D.

.

climbs.name: Edge of Freedom
climbs.fa: Euan Cameron and Julie Wright, 3rd July 2009

content.description:
Start 15 feet right of

D.D.D.

at a large flake.   Climb the short wall to reach the first bolt at the start of the slab.   Continue up the slab passing the second bolt on the right.   As you reach the overhanging corner step left and clip the 3rd bolt.

After the 3rd bolt the climbing steepens as you ascend the edge of the wall using a mixture of holds on the arete and small holds on the wall.

The crux section between the 3rd and 6th bolts provides good moves on solid rock with an exhilarating position.

After the 6th bolt continue up the slab to the anchors.
content.location:
Located on the right arete of the prominent corner of

D.D.D.

.

content.description: Easy but unprotected slab gains the first bolt about 25' up, after which two more bolts of face lead up and left (crux) into the dihedral which requires a deft blend of stemming and face climbing. The climbing eases near the top and concludes with a short section of perfect hands (2.5" piece optional).
content.location:
This is the striking left-facing corner system in the middle of the wall between

Anger Management

on the left and

Fall Harvest

on the right.

content.description:
Enjoyable slab climbing, never too sustained.  Its is a good introduction before tackling the more difficult

Fall Harvest

(5.10b) just to the left.

climbs.name: Anger Management
climbs.fa: Euan Cameron and Julie Wright, 26th July 2009

content.description:
This climb takes the steep hanging groove left of

D.D.D.

.

Start up the easy angled slab below the steep groove.   At the 3rd bolt pull onto the sloping ledge and eye the crux.   Bolts 4 through 6 provide the meat of the climb.

Progress up the groove with powerful fingery moves to a big move up to a large sloping shelf and the 6th bolt.

From here ascend the hanging slab with a fun sequence passing the last bolt up to the anchors.

Powerful climbing, unlike all the routes to the right.
content.location: Center of the left side of the wall
